member.name: T:DSharpPlus.CommandsNext.Attributes.CheckBaseAttribute
member.summary: Represents a base for all command pre-execution check attributes.

member.name: M:DSharpPlus.CommandsNext.Attributes.CheckBaseAttribute.ExecuteCheckAsync(DSharpPlus.CommandsNext.CommandContext,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Asynchronously checks whether this command can be executed within given context.
member.param: Context to check execution ability for.
Whether this check is being executed from help or not. This can be used to probe whether command can be run without setting off certain fail conditions (such as cooldowns).
member.returns: Whether the command can be executed in given context.

member.name: T:DSharpPlus.CommandsNext.Attributes.CooldownAttribute
member.summary: Defines a cooldown for this command. This allows you to define how many times can users execute a specific command

member.name: P:DSharpPlus.CommandsNext.Attributes.CooldownAttribute.MaxUses
member.summary: Gets the maximum number of uses before this command triggers a cooldown for its bucket.

member.name: P:DSharpPlus.CommandsNext.Attributes.CooldownAttribute.Reset
member.summary: Gets the time after which the cooldown is reset.

member.name: P:DSharpPlus.CommandsNext.Attributes.CooldownAttribute.BucketType
member.summary: Gets the type of the cooldown bucket. This determines how cooldowns are applied.

member.name: F:DSharpPlus.CommandsNext.Attributes.CooldownAttribute._buckets
member.summary: Gets the cooldown buckets for this command.

member.name: M:DSharpPlus.CommandsNext.Attributes.CooldownAttribute.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Double,DSharpPlus.CommandsNext.Attributes.CooldownBucketType)
member.summary: Defines a cooldown for this command. This means that users will be able to use the command a specific number of times before they have to wait to use it again.
member.param: Number of times the command can be used before triggering a cooldown.
Number of seconds after which the cooldown is reset.
Type of cooldown bucket. This allows controlling whether the bucket will be cooled down per user, guild, channel, or globally.

member.name: M:DSharpPlus.CommandsNext.Attributes.CooldownAttribute.GetBucket(DSharpPlus.CommandsNext.CommandContext)
member.summary: Gets a cooldown bucket for given command context.
member.param: Command context to get cooldown bucket for.
member.returns: Requested cooldown bucket, or null if one wasn't present.

member.name: M:DSharpPlus.CommandsNext.Attributes.CooldownAttribute.GetRemainingCooldown(DSharpPlus.CommandsNext.CommandContext)
member.summary: Calculates the cooldown remaining for given command context.
member.param: Context for which to calculate the cooldown.
member.returns: Remaining cooldown, or zero if no cooldown is active.

member.name: M:DSharpPlus.CommandsNext.Attributes.CooldownAttribute.GetBucketId(DSharpPlus.CommandsNext.CommandContext,System.UInt64@,System.UInt64@,System.UInt64@)
member.summary: Calculates bucket ID for given command context.
member.param: Context for which to calculate bucket ID for.
ID of the user with which this bucket is associated.
ID of the channel with which this bucket is associated.
ID of the guild with which this bucket is associated.

member.name: T:DSharpPlus.CommandsNext.Attributes.CooldownBucketType
member.summary: Defines how are command cooldowns applied.

member.name: F:DSharpPlus.CommandsNext.Attributes.CooldownBucketType.User
member.summary: Denotes that the command will have its cooldown applied per-user.

member.name: F:DSharpPlus.CommandsNext.Attributes.CooldownBucketType.Channel
member.summary: Denotes that the command will have its cooldown applied per-channel.

member.name: F:DSharpPlus.CommandsNext.Attributes.CooldownBucketType.Guild
member.summary: Denotes that the command will have its cooldown applied per-guild. In DMs, this applies the cooldown per-channel.

member.name: F:DSharpPlus.CommandsNext.Attributes.CooldownBucketType.Global
member.summary: Denotes that the command will have its cooldown applied globally.

member.summary: Defines this command overload's priority. This determines the order in which overloads will be attempted to be called. Commands will be attempted in order of priority, in descending order.

member.summary: Gets the priority of this command overload.

member.param: Priority of this command overload.

member.summary: Gets the permissions required by this attribute.

member.name: P:DSharpPlus.CommandsNext.Attributes.RequireBotPermissionsAttribute.IgnoreDms
member.summary: Gets this check's behaviour in DMs. True means the check will always pass in DMs, whereas false means that it will always fail.

member.summary: Defines that usage of this command is only possible when the bot is granted a specific permission.
member.param: Permissions required to execute this command.
Sets this check's behaviour in DMs. True means the check will always pass in DMs, whereas false means that it will always fail.

member.param: Permissions required to execute this command.

member.name: T:DSharpPlus.CommandsNext.PrefixResolverDelegate

summary.para: Represents a delegate for a function that takes a message, and returns the position of the start of command invocation in the message. It has to return -1 if prefix is not present.
It is recommended that helper methods and be used internally for checking. Their output can be passed through.

member.param: Message to check for prefix.
member.returns: Position of the command invocation or -1 if not present.

member.name: T:DSharpPlus.CommandsNext.CommandsNextConfiguration
member.summary: Represents a configuration for .

summary.para: Sets the string prefixes used for commands.
Defaults to no value (disabled).
Sets the custom prefix resolver used for commands.
Defaults to none (disabled).
Sets whether to allow mentioning the bot to be used as command prefix.
Defaults to true.
Sets whether strings should be matched in a case-sensitive manner.
This switch affects the behaviour of default prefix resolver, command searching, and argument conversion.
Defaults to false.
Sets whether to enable default help command.
Disabling this will allow you to make your own help command.
Modifying default help can be achieved via custom help formatters (see and for more details). It is recommended to use help formatter instead of disabling help.
Defaults to true.
Controls whether the default help will be sent via DMs or not.
Enabling this will make the bot respond with help via direct messages.
Defaults to false.
Sets the default pre-execution checks for the built-in help command.
Only applicable if default help is enabled.
Defaults to null.
Sets whether commands sent via direct messages should be processed.
Defaults to true.
Sets the service provider for this CommandsNext instance.
Objects in this provider are used when instantiating command modules. This allows passing data around without resorting to static members.
Defaults to null.
Gets whether any extra arguments passed to commands should be ignored or not. If this is set to false, extra arguments will throw, otherwise they will be ignored.
Defaults to false.
Sets the quotation marks on parameters, used to interpret spaces as part of a single argument.
Defaults to a collection of ", «, », ‘, “, „ and ‟.
Gets or sets whether to automatically enable handling commands.
If this is set to false, you will need to manually handle each incoming message and pass it to CommandsNext.
Defaults to true.
Gets or sets the default culture for parsers.
Defaults to invariant.
Gets or sets the default command executor.
This alters the behaviour, execution, and scheduling method of command execution.

member.summary: Creates a new instance of .

member.summary: Creates a new instance of , copying the properties of another configuration.
member.param: Configuration the properties of which are to be copied.

member.name: T:DSharpPlus.CommandsNext.Executors.AsynchronousCommandExecutor
member.summary: Executes commands using .

member.name: T:DSharpPlus.CommandsNext.Executors.ICommandExecutor
member.summary: Defines an API surface for all command executors.

member.name: M:DSharpPlus.CommandsNext.Executors.ICommandExecutor.ExecuteAsync(DSharpPlus.CommandsNext.CommandContext)
member.summary: Executes a command from given context.
member.param: Context to execute in.

member.name: T:DSharpPlus.CommandsNext.Executors.ParallelQueuedCommandExecutor
member.summary: A command executor which uses a bounded pool of executors to execute commands. This can limit the impact of commands on system resources, such as CPU usage.

member.name: P:DSharpPlus.CommandsNext.Executors.ParallelQueuedCommandExecutor.Parallelism
member.summary: Gets the degree of parallelism of this executor.

member.name: M:DSharpPlus.CommandsNext.Executors.ParallelQueuedCommandExecutor.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new executor, which uses up to 75% of system CPU resources.

member.name: M:DSharpPlus.CommandsNext.Executors.ParallelQueuedCommandExecutor.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a new executor with specified degree of parallelism.
member.param: The number of workers to use. It is recommended this number does not exceed 150% of the physical CPU count.

member.name: M:DSharpPlus.CommandsNext.Executors.ParallelQueuedCommandExecutor.Dispose
member.summary: Disposes of the resources used by this executor.

member.name: T:DSharpPlus.CommandsNext.Executors.SynchronousCommandExecutor
member.summary: Executes commands by awaiting them.

member.name: M:DSharpPlus.CommandsNext.ExtensionMethods.GetCommandsNextAsync(DSharpPlus.DiscordShardedClient)
member.summary: Gets the active CommandsNext modules for all shards in this client.
member.param: Client to get CommandsNext instances from.
member.returns: A dictionary of the modules, indexed by shard id.
